borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p>The proposed front extension,&nbsp;due
to its combination with the flat roof of the side extension, depth,
window scape proposed and overall discordant design across part of the dwelling
will be an unsympathetic and discordant addition to the dwelling. The proposed side conservatory, by&nbsp;reason of its uncharacteristic design when combined with the existing additions and
location in a prominent&nbsp;part of the Banjo cul-de-sac, window scape proposed and roof design&nbsp;is uncomplimentary&nbsp;and discordant,
harmful to the character of the host dwelling, terrace and wider Becontree
Estate, contrary to:</p><p>&nbsp;- National
Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies HC1, D1 and D4 of the Draft London Plan (December 2019)<br>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)<br>- Policies BP2, BP5 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies&nbsp;<span style="line-height: 107%;">SPP6,
SP2, DMD1,&nbsp;DMD6 and DMD4&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19
Consultation version, October&nbsp;2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p></o:p></p>
description: Construction of a single storey front extension including front porch and construction of a single storey side conservatory.
